tournament.name: Star City Games Open San Jose

decks.notes: The main idea of this RUG Control deck is to control the game by using counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with Lotus Cobra and Explore. The deck then aims to win by dropping powerful threats like Avenger of Zendikar, Frost Titan, and Inferno Titan. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Garruk Wildspeaker to outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and take over the game with its powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mana Leak to disrupt your opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. The deck also includes ramp cards like Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya to accelerate your mana production and play expensive threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Frost Titan. By controlling the game early on and overwhelming your opponent with powerful spells and creatures, you can secure victory through attrition and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing counterspells and board wipes to control the pace of the game. By leveraging cards like Spell Pierce, Mana Leak, and Day of Judgment, the player can disrupt their opponent's strategy and maintain a strong defensive position. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura to help establish dominance on the battlefield. Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge provide additional disruption by limiting the opponent's resources. The goal is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and superior card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with creatures like Arbor Elf and Llanowar Elves, allowing for an early board presence with powerful elves like Elvish Archdruid and Joraga Warcaller. Utilizing buffs from cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Oran-Rief, the Vastwood, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of elf creatures. Cards like Fauna Shaman and Vengevine provide additional utility and recursion, while Eldrazi Monument and Nissa Revane offer additional support and finishers to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize control elements such as counterspells and board wipes to maintain board control while using card advantage and incremental threats to win the game. The deck focuses on card advantage with Squadron Hawk, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Preordain, along with removal like Journey to Nowhere and Day of Judgment. The win conditions are typically Elspeth Tirel and Gideon Jura, along with Celestial Colonnade as a manland. The deck aims to control the game until it can secure a win through its powerful planeswalkers and resilient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing powerful creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore, the deck can quickly deploy threats such as Avenger of Zendikar and Inferno Titan. With a mix of card draw, counter spells, and removal, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent while setting up for strong finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Garruk Wildspeaker. The land base and card selection tools help ensure consistency and efficient gameplay.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Kargan Dragonlord, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Bolt. Cards like Basilisk Collar provide additional value by giving our creatures lifelink, and Koth of the Hammer helps ramp up our mana production. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, consistent damage output while controlling the board with removal spells like Arc Trail and Searing Blaze.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful control spells and creatures to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent. By efficiently ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya, the deck aims to quickly play out powerful threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Frost Titan. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells, counterspells, and card draw to help maintain control of the game. Additionally, the deck features lands that can provide additional utility and card advantage, further enhancing the control aspect.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up damage by repeatedly playing lands and triggering landfall abilities to pump up creatures like Steppe Lynx and Plated Geopede. The inclusion of cards like Adventuring Gear and Sword of Body and Mind further enhance the aggression of the deck. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to deal with opposing threats. Stoneforge Mystic and Squadron Hawk provide card advantage and consistency, while Koth of the Hammer can generate additional mana for explosive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive vampire creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining low-cost creatures with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Staggershock, the deck aims to keep pressure on the opponent while also maintaining card advantage with Dark Tutelage. The inclusion of Viscera Seer and Bloodghast allows for efficient sacrifice outlets and recurring threats, while the land base ensures a smooth mana curve for consistent aggression. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures and burn spells.

The main idea of this RUG control deck is to establish early board control through cards like Lightning Bolt and Mana Leak, while ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore. The deck aims to control the game with powerful creatures like Frost Titan and Inferno Titan, while using Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and disruption. The deck also includes land destruction elements with Acidic Slime to disrupt opponent's strategies. The overall strategy revolves around controlling the game tempo, ramping up mana, and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Joraga Treespeaker and Lotus Cobra, while also controlling the board with Acidic Slime and Frost Titan. The key strategy is to use Genesis Wave to put a large number of permanents directly onto the battlefield, which can lead to overwhelming your opponent with powerful creatures and land destruction. Spreading Seas helps to fix mana and disrupt the opponent's lands, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control. The ultimate goal is to set up a powerful board state and win through sheer advantage.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana, using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Lotus Cobra, and Overgrown Battlement to quickly reach high amounts of mana. It then aims to play Genesis Wave for a potentially game-winning turn, putting powerful creatures onto the battlefield like Frost Titan and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes cards like Acidic Slime and Spreading Seas for disruption and control, with Jace, the Mind Sculptor providing card advantage and control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and win through a massive Genesis Wave.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells and removal spells to keep the opponent's threats at bay. The deck also includes cards like Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic to provide card advantage and access to powerful equipment like Sword of Body and Mind. The win condition of the deck is to either overwhelm the opponent with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Gideon Jura, and Elspeth Tirel or to beat them down with creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Celestial Colonnade. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's control strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Overgrown Battlement and Cultivate to bring out powerful creatures like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Pyroclasm while setting up Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes land fetching cards like Harrow to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and burn spells powered by Valakut's ability.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and controlling the board with removal spells until the player can combo off with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan to deal massive amounts of direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to play a defensive game until it can assemble its combo pieces and win the game in one explosive turn. By efficiently ramping up mana and managing resources, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful spells and abilities.
